meanings.definition: The act of delaying or postponing something.
meanings.sent1: The deferment of the meeting allowed everyone more time to prepare.
meanings.sent2: I requested a deferment of my payment deadline until next month.
meanings.sent3: The deferment of dessert until after dinner made the kids very impatient.
meanings.sent4: Her deferment of the decision was like pressing pause on a video.
meanings.sent5: The deferment of the train departure was announced over the loudspeaker.

meanings.definition: The action of putting off an event or action to a later time.
meanings.sent1: The deferment of the party to next weekend disappointed many guests.
meanings.sent2: The deferment of the project deadline caused some stress among the team.
meanings.sent3: The deferment of the picnic due to rain led to an impromptu indoor game day.
meanings.sent4: His deferment of the decision was like a cloud hanging over his head.
meanings.sent5: The deferment of the concert made the anticipation even greater.
